title: What's Your Upgrade Readiness Score?
subtitle: Answer 10 quick questions to find out if you're ready to upgrade from HDB to condo.

questions.text: How long have you owned your current HDB?
What's your estimated HDB market value?
Do you have savings set aside beyond CPF for the upgrade?
What is your combined household monthly income?
Has your family size changed — or is it about to?

options.label: Kids growing up, need more space

questions.text: How do you feel about your current living space?
What's your ideal timeline to upgrade?
Do you know your MOP (Minimum Occupation Period) status?

options.label: I think I know, but not sure

questions.text: Have you explored financing options for a condo purchase?

options.label: Spoken to a bank or broker

questions.text: Have you spoken to a property advisor about upgrading?

options.label: Yes, in detail with a plan

tiers.label: You're Ready to Upgrade
tiers.summary: Your finances, lifestyle needs, and knowledge are aligned. You're in a strong position to make the move.

tiers.label: You're Almost There
tiers.summary: You're close to being fully ready. A few areas need attention, but upgrading is well within reach.

tiers.label: You're on the Right Track
tiers.summary: You've made solid progress. With the right guidance, you could be ready sooner than you think.

tiers.label: Start Planning Your Upgrade
tiers.summary: It's early days, but that's okay. Starting to plan now puts you ahead of most people.

financial.high: Your financial position is strong. You likely have the equity and savings to support an upgrade with minimal cash outlay.
financial.mid: Your finances are on the right track, but there are areas to strengthen. A detailed financial plan could reveal options you haven't considered.
financial.low: Building your financial foundation is the key priority. Focus on growing your CPF OA balance and setting aside savings for the upgrade.

lifestyle.high: Your lifestyle needs clearly point toward more space and better amenities. The timing feels right for your family.
lifestyle.mid: You're starting to feel the pull toward upgrading. Clarifying your must-haves will help you act when the time comes.
lifestyle.low: You seem comfortable for now, but it's smart to plan ahead. Life changes can come faster than expected.

knowledge.high: You've done your homework. You understand the process and are well-prepared to make informed decisions.
knowledge.mid: You know the basics, but there are important details that could save you significant money. A strategy session would fill the gaps.
knowledge.low: There's a lot to learn about the HDB-to-condo process, and that's completely normal. Most families start exactly where you are.
